alert.note: Alert for Giles; Hickman; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 7:01AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marshall, southwestern Rutherford, Maury, southern Williamson, northeastern Giles, northwestern Bedford and southeastern Hickman Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 700 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northwest of Columbia, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Columbia, Shelbyville, Lewisburg, Centerville, Spring Hill, Mount Pleasant, Thompson`s Station, Chapel Hill, Cornersville, Eagleville, Lynnville, Culleoka, Primm Springs, I-65 East Of Columbia, Santa Fe, Rover, Belfast, Deason and Williamsport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 19 and 65. Interstate 840 between mile markers 12 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
